intro: Gerbera oblonga, commonly known as the African gerbera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with brightly colored petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gerbera oblonga thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its vibrant blooms come in shades of red, yellow, and white, adding a striking visual appeal to any landscape.
